alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Mecklenburg, south central Gaston and northwestern York Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of York, or near Smyrna, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, York, South Gastonia, Clover, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Kings Mountain State Park, Steele Creek and Lake Wylie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
